DataElement.preferredName: Patient Transcutaneous Electrical Nerve Stimulation Medical Device Fit Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The indication of whether a patient's limb fits the transcutaneous electrical nerve stimulation medical device that meets the criteria for participation in a clinical trial.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Patient Transcutaneous Electrical Nerve Stimulation Medical Device Fit Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary._A non-invasive form of electroanalgesia that uses conductive gel pads to transmit electrical energy from an external stimulator to peripheral nerves.  There are two forms: low-intensity/high frequency and high-intensity/low frequency (dense disperse).  The method of action is suspected to involve release of endogenous opioids.  It is often used for peripheral neuropathic pain. (from White, Li, and Chiu)_Any physical object that is useful for prevention, diagnosis, monitoring, or treatment of disease or other conditions._Satisfy a condition or restriction._Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A person who requires medical care.

Concepts.definition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.

Property.preferredName: Transcutaneous Electrical Nerve Stimulation Medical Device Fit Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
Property.preferredDefinition: A non-invasive form of electroanalgesia that uses conductive gel pads to transmit electrical energy from an external stimulator to peripheral nerves.  There are two forms: low-intensity/high frequency and high-intensity/low frequency (dense disperse).  The method of action is suspected to involve release of endogenous opioids.  It is often used for peripheral neuropathic pain. (from White, Li, and Chiu):Any physical object that is useful for prevention, diagnosis, monitoring, or treatment of disease or other conditions.:Satisfy a condition or restriction.:Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

Concepts.definition: A non-invasive form of electroanalgesia that uses conductive gel pads to transmit electrical energy from an external stimulator to peripheral nerves.  There are two forms: low-intensity/high frequency and high-intensity/low frequency (dense disperse).  The method of action is suspected to involve release of endogenous opioids.  It is often used for peripheral neuropathic pain. (from White, Li, and Chiu)
Any physical object that is useful for prevention, diagnosis, monitoring, or treatment of disease or other conditions.
Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2022.12.28 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0001837. aj

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.

RepresentationTerm.changeDescription: 10.3.20 TL changed WFS from RETIRED PHASED OUT to RETIRED ARCHIVED. Changed Workflow Status DBW 04-27-2016

ValueDomain.changeDescription: 8/29/17 tt added CSI per Round 5 finalization task. 3/12/17 jk added Standard reg status; ownership transfered from CTEP to NCI Standards with concurrence of CTEP/Brian Campbell. jk

ReferenceDocuments.name: Have a leg that is too small
ReferenceDocuments.description: Have a leg that is too small or too large for the TENS device to fit securely.
